forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.shortForecast: Mostly Cloudy then Slight Chance Light Snow
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of snow after 1am. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 8. Wind chill values as low as -5. North wind 5 to 13 mph, with gusts as high as 25 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.

forecast.name: Sunday
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of snow. Cloudy, with a high near 24. Wind chill values as low as -4. North wind 14 to 17 mph, with gusts as high as 31 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.

weather_report:
As Boston sinks into the quiet embrace of night, a chill lingers in the air, whispering promises of snow that may dance softly across the ground as dawn approaches. The temperature, resting at a cutting 8 degrees, feels even more biting with the wind chill plummeting to an almost oppressive -5. The steady north wind carries with it a briskness that compels residents to tuck their chins deeper into warm scarves. Though the forecast hints at a slight chance of snow, both the heavens and the earth seem to hold their breath, presenting a predominantly overcast canvas punctuated occasionally by glimpses of distant city lights.

As Sunday unfurls its wings, it will greet us with a slightly warmer embrace, presenting a high hovering near 24. Yet, as the wind reasserts its playful dominance, chills will still nip at exposed skin, recalling the relentless beauty of winter. For those brave hearts compelled to venture outside, layers will be your ally—a thermal base under a cozy sweater, topped with a sturdy coat, wool gloves, and a perhaps an incongruously bright hat to counter the drab palette of the day. 

This day, marked by a muted sky and soft stillness, invites one to sip hot coffee from a favorite spot while gazing at the quaint corners of the neighborhood. Or, perhaps, a leisurely stroll through the well-trodden paths of the Common will reveal the hidden charms of a winter landscape. As snowflakes flutter, one can revel in the simple pleasure of the serene, wintry air, appreciating the solitude that blankets the city.
